snippet: Over three years of state budget cuts, the University of California has reacted more or less stoically, with administrators saying they would simply have to run a leaner, more competitive institution.   But this year, when state lawmakers called f...
lead_paragraph: Over three years of state budget cuts, the University of California has reacted more or less stoically, with administrators saying they would simply have to run a leaner, more competitive institution. But this year, when state lawmakers called for reductions even beyond the $138 million proposed by Gov. Pete Wilson for 1993-94, the politeness evaporated.

headline.main: Facing 4th Year of Cuts, Berkeley Chancellor Leads Budget Revolt
